Sentencas: Concentration polarization is important because it determines the maximum power output of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) at high fuel utilization.
Titulo: Diffusion limitations in the porous anodes of SOFCs

Sentencas: Anodic concentration polarization occurs when the demand for reactants exceeds the capacity of the porous cermet anode to supply them by gas diffusion mechanisms.
Titulo: Diffusion limitations in the porous anodes of SOFCs

Sentencas: High tortuosities (bulk diffusion resistances) are often assumed to explain this behavior.
Titulo: Diffusion limitations in the porous anodes of SOFCs

Sentencas: However, recent experiments show that anodic concentration polarization originates in the immediate vicinity of the reactive triple phase boundary (TPB) sites near the anode/electrolyte interface.
Titulo: Diffusion limitations in the porous anodes of SOFCs

Sentencas: A model is proposed to describe how concentration polarization is controlled by two localized phenomena: competetive adsorption of reactants in areas adjacent to the reactive TPB sites, followed by relatively slow surface diffusion to the reactive sites.
Titulo: Diffusion limitations in the porous anodes of SOFCs

Sentencas: Results suggest that future SOFC anode design improvements should focus on optimization of the reactive area, adsorption, and surface diffusion at the anode/electrolyte interface.
Titulo: Diffusion limitations in the porous anodes of SOFCs
Diffusion limitations in the porous anodes of SOFCs
